rev.comment: undo fair use abuse via WP:NFCC. See Talk:Characters_of_Final_Fantasy_VII#Image_removal

Line 10: Line 10:
==Main playable characters==
==Main playable characters==
===Zidane Tribal===
===Zidane Tribal===
â
[[Image:Zidane Tribal character.jpg|100px|right|Zidane Tribal]]
 
{{nihongo|'''Zidane Tribal'''|ã¸ã¿ã³ã»ãã©ã¤ãã«|Jitan Toraibaru|extra=[[International Phonetic Alphabet|IPA]]: {{IPA|[ziËdan ËtraÉªbl]}}}} is the protagonist of ''[[Final Fantasy IX]]''. Playful and flirtatious, Zidane displays little of the sullenness associated with previous Final Fantasy protagonists. Zidane has shoulder-length blonde hair and a prehensile monkey-like tail, as witnessed in game when Zidane hangs from his tail to evade Steiner. In trance form Zidane's hair becomes longer, and his clothing is replaced with thick fur covering his body. It is not revealed whether or not he has fur under his clothing when not in trance form. Zidane is identified as a [[Final Fantasy character classes#Thief|thief]].<ref>''FINAL FANTASY IX Official Strategy Guide''. Brady Publishing, 2001.</ref>
{{nihongo|'''Zidane Tribal'''|ã¸ã¿ã³ã»ãã©ã¤ãã«|Jitan Toraibaru|extra=[[International Phonetic Alphabet|IPA]]: {{IPA|[ziËdan ËtraÉªbl]}}}} is the protagonist of ''[[Final Fantasy IX]]''. Playful and flirtatious, Zidane displays little of the sullenness associated with previous Final Fantasy protagonists. Zidane has shoulder-length blonde hair and a prehensile monkey-like tail, as witnessed in game when Zidane hangs from his tail to evade Steiner. In trance form Zidane's hair becomes longer, and his clothing is replaced with thick fur covering his body. It is not revealed whether or not he has fur under his clothing when not in trance form. Zidane is identified as a [[Final Fantasy character classes#Thief|thief]].<ref>''FINAL FANTASY IX Official Strategy Guide''. Brady Publishing, 2001.</ref>
Line 23: Line 22:
===Garnet Til Alexandros XVII===
===Garnet Til Alexandros XVII===
â
[[Image:Garnet Til Alexandros XVII character.jpg|75px|right|Princess Garnet of Alexandria]]
 
{{nihongo|'''Garnet Til Alexandros XVII'''|ã¬ã¼ãããã»ãã£ã«ã»ã¢ã¬ã¯ãµã³ãã­ã¹17ä¸|GÄnetto tiru Arekusandorosu JÅ«nanasei}}, is the heroine of ''[[Final Fantasy IX]]''. Garnet is the Princess of [[List of Final Fantasy IX locations|Alexandria]] -- one of three major nations located on [[List of Final Fantasy IX locations|Gaia's]] [[List of Final Fantasy IX locations|Mist Continent]]. She is the only heir to the royal throne. A beautiful young woman, Garnet is well spoken and highly educated, but also possessed of a strong will and a stubborn streak. However, due to her sheltered upbringing she is also shy and slightly naive. In battle, she can cast white magic and summon eidolons.
{{nihongo|'''Garnet Til Alexandros XVII'''|ã¬ã¼ãããã»ãã£ã«ã»ã¢ã¬ã¯ãµã³ãã­ã¹17ä¸|GÄnetto tiru Arekusandorosu JÅ«nanasei}}, is the heroine of ''[[Final Fantasy IX]]''. Garnet is the Princess of [[List of Final Fantasy IX locations|Alexandria]] -- one of three major nations located on [[List of Final Fantasy IX locations|Gaia's]] [[List of Final Fantasy IX locations|Mist Continent]]. She is the only heir to the royal throne. A beautiful young woman, Garnet is well spoken and highly educated, but also possessed of a strong will and a stubborn streak. However, due to her sheltered upbringing she is also shy and slightly naive. In battle, she can cast white magic and summon eidolons.

Line 62: Line 59:
===Adelbert Steiner===
===Adelbert Steiner===
â
[[Image:Adelbert Steiner.jpg|200px|right|Captain Adelbert Steiner]]
 
{{nihongo|'''Adelbert Steiner'''|ã¢ãã«ãã¼ãã»ã¹ã¿ã¤ãã¼|AderubÄto SutainÄ}} is the Captain of the Knights of Pluto, the only male troop in Alexandria's military force. Steiner usually has a massive frown to go with a grouchy disposition. Steiner is unusual amongst ''[[Final Fantasy]]'' characters, in that while the game allows the player to customise his name, the name the player chooses becomes his [[surname]] instead of his first name. For instance, if the player entered the name "Stephen," the character would be called "Captain Adelbert Stephen." This also makes him one of the only Final Fantasy characters to be called by both the first and last name given in the game's manual during actual gameplay.
{{nihongo|'''Adelbert Steiner'''|ã¢ãã«ãã¼ãã»ã¹ã¿ã¤ãã¼|AderubÄto SutainÄ}} is the Captain of the Knights of Pluto, the only male troop in Alexandria's military force. Steiner usually has a massive frown to go with a grouchy disposition. Steiner is unusual amongst ''[[Final Fantasy]]'' characters, in that while the game allows the player to customise his name, the name the player chooses becomes his [[surname]] instead of his first name. For instance, if the player entered the name "Stephen," the character would be called "Captain Adelbert Stephen." This also makes him one of the only Final Fantasy characters to be called by both the first and last name given in the game's manual during actual gameplay.
Line 74: Line 70:
===Freya Crescent===
===Freya Crescent===
â
[[Image:Freya Crescent character.jpg|200px|right]]
 
{{nihongo|'''Freya Crescent'''|ãã©ã¤ã¤ã»ã¯ã¬ã»ã³ã|Furaiya Kuresento|extra=[[International Phonetic Alphabet|IPA]]: {{IPA|[ËfraÉªÉ ËkrÉsnt]}}}} is [[Races of Final Fantasy#Burmecian|Burmecian]], a race of [[anthropomorphic]] [[rats]] (according to many indications in the game, and by Squaresoft) who mainly live in two cities, Burmecia and Cleyra. Freya's name is homonymous with that of the [[Freyja|Norse goddess of fertility]], while her surname is homonymous with the English word [[crescent]].
{{nihongo|'''Freya Crescent'''|ãã©ã¤ã¤ã»ã¯ã¬ã»ã³ã|Furaiya Kuresento|extra=[[International Phonetic Alphabet|IPA]]: {{IPA|[ËfraÉªÉ ËkrÉsnt]}}}} is [[Races of Final Fantasy#Burmecian|Burmecian]], a race of [[anthropomorphic]] [[rats]] (according to many indications in the game, and by Squaresoft) who mainly live in two cities, Burmecia and Cleyra. Freya's name is homonymous with that of the [[Freyja|Norse goddess of fertility]], while her surname is homonymous with the English word [[crescent]].
Line 86: Line 81:
===Quina Quen===
===Quina Quen===
â
[[Image:Quina Quen character.jpg|150px|right]]
 
{{nihongo|'''Quina Quen'''|ã¯ã¤ãã»ã¯ã¥ã¨ã³|Kuina Kuen}} is a [[Races of Final Fantasy#Qu|Qu]] of indeterminate gender. Quina's master, Quale, wants Quina to travel the world so that s/he will learn that there's more to life than food. Like the rest of the Qu Tribe, Quina speaks in broken English. Quina's unique ability is called [[Final Fantasy magic#Blue Magic|Blue Magic]] (Blu Magic in the battle menu) which allows it to use enemy abilities acquired in battle by using the Eat command on certain enemies. Quina's philosophy is that there are only two things: "things you can eat and things you no can eat." Its favorite food is [[frog]]s. Quina is separated from the rest of the party at several points in the game.
{{nihongo|'''Quina Quen'''|ã¯ã¤ãã»ã¯ã¥ã¨ã³|Kuina Kuen}} is a [[Races of Final Fantasy#Qu|Qu]] of indeterminate gender. Quina's master, Quale, wants Quina to travel the world so that s/he will learn that there's more to life than food. Like the rest of the Qu Tribe, Quina speaks in broken English. Quina's unique ability is called [[Final Fantasy magic#Blue Magic|Blue Magic]] (Blu Magic in the battle menu) which allows it to use enemy abilities acquired in battle by using the Eat command on certain enemies. Quina's philosophy is that there are only two things: "things you can eat and things you no can eat." Its favorite food is [[frog]]s. Quina is separated from the rest of the party at several points in the game.
Line 100: Line 94:
===Eiko Carol===
===Eiko Carol===
â
[[Image:Eiko Carol character.jpg|100px|right]]
 
{{nihongo|'''Eiko Carol'''|ã¨ã¼ã³ã»ã­ã£ã«ãªã«|Äko Kyaruoru}} is one of the playable characters that joins the party in the second disc of the game. She is the only person who appears in the game with a Summoner's Horn. While Eiko and Garnet both share White Magic and Summoner abilities, Eiko uses primarily white magic with her summoner powers taking a secondary role, indicated by the order of said skills on the battle menu. Her summon abilities are usually holy-based summons or summons that add supporting effects. Some examples are Phoenix, which randomly revives the player in battle, and Madeen, which causes Holy damage.
{{nihongo|'''Eiko Carol'''|ã¨ã¼ã³ã»ã­ã£ã«ãªã«|Äko Kyaruoru}} is one of the playable characters that joins the party in the second disc of the game. She is the only person who appears in the game with a Summoner's Horn. While Eiko and Garnet both share White Magic and Summoner abilities, Eiko uses primarily white magic with her summoner powers taking a secondary role, indicated by the order of said skills on the battle menu. Her summon abilities are usually holy-based summons or summons that add supporting effects. Some examples are Phoenix, which randomly revives the player in battle, and Madeen, which causes Holy damage.
Line 110: Line 103:
===Amarant Coral===
===Amarant Coral===
â
[[Image:Amarant Coral character.jpg|100px|right]]
 
'''Amarant Coral''' is the last character to join the party. His name in the Japanese version of the game is {{nihongo|'''Salamander Coral'''|ãµã©ãã³ãã¼ã»ã³ã¼ã©ã«|SaramandÄ KÅraru}}, a possible reference to the mythological [[Fire (classical element)|fire]] creature ''[[Salamander#Mythology|Salamander]]'' as he is known as "The Flaming Amarant" ("The Flaming Salamander").<ref>'''Amarant:''' Some call me the Flaming Amarant. (''Final Fantasy IX'')</ref> In the game Amarant has also been called "Red"<ref>'''Lani:''' What are you tryin' to do, Red!? I thought you're supposed to be the number one bandit! (''Final Fantasy IX'')</ref> and in his introductory battle he's identified as "Scarlet Hair". He fights using various gloves or knuckles, much like the [[Final Fantasy character classes#Monk|monk]] character class in other ''Final Fantasy'' games, but also possesses the "Throw" command, normally associated with the [[Final Fantasy character classes#Ninja|ninja]] class. His mind is filled with rules of fighting, the biggest of them being "The Victorious Live, and the Defeated Die". Amarant's combative nature and arrogant attitude often leads to conflict, but eventually his personality begins to change under [[Zidane Tribal|Zidane]]'s influence.<ref name="influence">'''Zidane:''' Funny how you put that in past tense. All due to my wonderful influence. / '''Amarant:''' Pshhh. What do you want me to do? Thank you? (''Final Fantasy IX'')</ref>
'''Amarant Coral''' is the last character to join the party. His name in the Japanese version of the game is {{nihongo|'''Salamander Coral'''|ãµã©ãã³ãã¼ã»ã³ã¼ã©ã«|SaramandÄ KÅraru}}, a possible reference to the mythological [[Fire (classical element)|fire]] creature ''[[Salamander#Mythology|Salamander]]'' as he is known as "The Flaming Amarant" ("The Flaming Salamander").<ref>'''Amarant:''' Some call me the Flaming Amarant. (''Final Fantasy IX'')</ref> In the game Amarant has also been called "Red"<ref>'''Lani:''' What are you tryin' to do, Red!? I thought you're supposed to be the number one bandit! (''Final Fantasy IX'')</ref> and in his introductory battle he's identified as "Scarlet Hair". He fights using various gloves or knuckles, much like the [[Final Fantasy character classes#Monk|monk]] character class in other ''Final Fantasy'' games, but also possesses the "Throw" command, normally associated with the [[Final Fantasy character classes#Ninja|ninja]] class. His mind is filled with rules of fighting, the biggest of them being "The Victorious Live, and the Defeated Die". Amarant's combative nature and arrogant attitude often leads to conflict, but eventually his personality begins to change under [[Zidane Tribal|Zidane]]'s influence.<ref name="influence">'''Zidane:''' Funny how you put that in past tense. All due to my wonderful influence. / '''Amarant:''' Pshhh. What do you want me to do? Thank you? (''Final Fantasy IX'')</ref>
